metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29945 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The WebAssembly JIT could miscalculate the size of a return type, which could lead to a null read and result in a crash. *Note: This issue only affected x86-32 platforms. Other platforms are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
